article.class: post-2425 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-announcement entry has-post-thumbnail

h2.a: April 16 – School Closure for Remainder of the Academic Year

div.p: Governor Greg Abbott announced an executive order today, April 16, 2020 to close all schools in the state of Texas for the remainder of the 2019-20 academic year. UT Elementary School and UT Charter School, along with all other districts in the state, will comply with this executive order and… read more

article.class: post-2419 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-uncategorized entry

h2.a: Helping Kids Learn at Home Video Series

div.p: The Meadows Center for Preventing Educational Risk (MCPER), longtime partner for UT Elementary, has created a series of videos called Helping Kids Learn at Home to help parents help their children with schoolwork. The brief videos, in both English and Spanish, are designed for busy parents and currently feature topics… read more

article.class: post-2415 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-uncategorized entry has-post-thumbnail

h2.a: Updated Information on Meals During Closure – Información Actualizada Sobre Comidas Durante el Cierre de la Escuela

div.p: April 13, 2020 Texas parents and caregivers can visit the TXSchools.gov MealFinder Map to find locations near them where local school systems are offering free school meals—both breakfast and lunch—for pick-up while school buildings are closed because of the novel coronavirus (COVID-19). Launched by the Texas Education Agency (TEA), in… read more

article.class: post-2409 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-uncategorized entry has-post-thumbnail

h2.a: April 9 Update: UT Elementary campus will remain closed indefinitely

div.p: The following is an important message from the UT Charter School System Superintendent Dr. Melissa M. Chavez and UT Elementary Principal Dr. Nicole Whetstone. If you have any problems viewing this message, please see the attached documents in English and Spanish (ES). El siguiente es un mensaje importante del… read more

article.class: post-2326 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-uncategorized entry

h2.a: 2020-2021 Pre-K Applications will be available May 1st

div.p: Pre-K Applications for the 2020-2021 Lottery will be available May 1st. You will have the opportunity to make an appointment to turn in application with supporting documentation or email it in. The Lottery will be held on June 5th.

article.class: post-2269 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-uncategorized entry has-post-thumbnail

h2.a: UTES Moving Classes Online – Moviendo las Clases en Línea

div.p: As a measure to reduce the spread of the COVID-19 (coronavirus), The University of Texas at Austin is moving all classes online for the remainder of the Spring 2020 semester. This includes classes at UT Elementary. UT Elementary will begin online, remote learning on April 6. All students will be… read more

article.class: post-2260 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-announcement entry

h2.a: Meals During School Closures – Comidas Durante el Cierre de la Escuela

div.p: March 23, 2020 Texas parents and caregivers can now visit the TXSchools.gov MealFinder Map to find locations near them where local school systems are offering free school meals—both breakfast and lunch—for pick-up while school buildings are closed because of the novel coronavirus (COVID-19). Launched by the Texas Education Agency (TEA), in partnership… read more
Visit our Distance Learning Resources page to find recommended resources for virtual learning. We’ll continue to update throughout the semester.
Please see our Coronavirus Resources page for ongoing updates and resources as we transition to online learning.
